#Text=Irbit
#Text=Irbit ( Russian : Ирби́т eer-BEET ) is a town in Sverdlovsk Oblast , Russia , about 203 km from Yekaterinburg by train or 250 km by car on the right bank of the Nitsa River .
#Text=It is crossed by long distance railway Yekaterinburg – Tavda –
#Text=Ustye-Akha and by road traffic routes , directed to Kamyshlov , Artyomovsk , Turinsk , and Tyumen .
#Text=Total area of the town is approximately 64 km ² .
#Text=Population : 42,578 ( 2005 est. )
#Text=Get in
#Text=There are a few direct trains from Moscow and more frequent trains from Yekaterinburg .
#Text=Buses run several times a day from Yekaterinburg to Irbit .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The city is well served by several bus routes running approximately every 20 minutes , and by frequent marshrutki ( fixed route taxis ) and several taxi companies .
#Text=Maps of the city are available from the Konica kiosks and book shops .
#Text=See
#Text=Irbit State Museum of Fine Art .
#Text=It contains some important works including etchings by famous European artists .
#Text=It is the only museum in Russia specializing in engravings .
#Text=Irbit State Motorcycle Museum .
#Text=It was created as a State Museum of the Russian Federation to protect the former IMZ Factory Museum from sale and dispersal .
#Text=The museum was opened in 2004 as the Irbit Motorcycle Museum .
#Text=The keystone of the museum was the collection of the Design Department of the IMZ factory acquired by local authorities in 2002 .
#Text=It is temporarily housed in a building at 100a Ulitsa Soviestskaya , in Irbit , while a permanent home is built in Ulitsa Lenina .
#Text=It received the status of a State Museum of the Russian Federation in 2006 .
#Text=The museum contains an extensive collection of production , racing and prototype bikes from the IMZ-Ural Factory , and many foreign models from a wide range of manufacturers .
#Text=The collection is unique in its display of the development of the Russian heavy motorcycle .
#Text=Irbit Ethnographical Museum .
#Text=Irbit Motorcycle Factory , 100 Ulitsa Soviestskaya .
#Text=Sretenskaya Church .
#Text=One of the two remaining churches in Irbit .
#Text=It 's at the edge of the historic Yamarka area and is undergoing restoration .
#Text=Do
#Text=Irbit offers plenty of cross-country skiing , with trails stretching for kilometres .
#Text=There are some downhill skiing runs as well .
#Text=It will take you about 5 minutes to get to the Ski Base from the centre of the city by taxi .
#Text=In summer the same area provides enjoyable hiking trails .
#Text=The Irbit Bike Show ( Ирбитский байк слёт ) is held every year at the end of July .
#Text=It is organised by the local bike club as a celebration of the town 's importance as a manufacturer of heavy motorcycles ( see IMZ-Ural ) in the Soviet Union and in Russia .
#Text=Thousands of riders from throughout the Sverdlovsk region and other parts of Russia attend , and increasingly more foreign riders are attending .
#Text=Irbit round of the Russian Motorcross championships are held every August at the Hippodrome .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Staraya Melnitsa ( The Old Mill ) located on Sovietskaya
#Text=St is the oldest restaurant in the city and has a good reputation .
#Text=There is a pleasant café opposite in Detski Mir ( Children 's World ) .
#Text=Another restaurant is found behind the Hotel Nitsa .
#Text=Drink
#Text=In Summer , beer tents pop-up in various locations throughout the city .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Accommodation is limited to a few hotels .
#Text=Hotel Nitsa , ☏ +734355 37-510 .
#Text=Hotel Povorot , 75 Svobody St , ☏ +734355 37-100 .
#Text=Irbit Glass Factory , ☏ +734355 29-366 .
